summary: This document is an email chain from April 15, 2020, forwarding a public tip submitted to the FBI's National Threat Operations Center. The tip reports a sighting of Ghislaine Maxwell, who was a fugitive at the time, allegedly playing with two children in a forested area in New Hampshire. The tip also mentions the murder of a philanthropist in Toronto, speculating it may be related to Epstein and Maxwell.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the FBI tip. A tipster reports seeing a woman matching her description playing hide and seek with two children in a forested area behind a home, and a child called out a name similar to hers.

events.title: Reported sighting of Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: A tipster reports seeing a woman believed to be Ghislaine Maxwell playing hide and seek with two children (a female approx. 9 and a male approx. 13) in a forested area behind a home.

events.title: Mini Cooper parked at location
events.description: A red Mini Cooper with white trim, allegedly associated with Maxwell, was reportedly parked at an address from Friday, April 10, until Tuesday, April 14, 2020.

events.title: FBI tip submission
events.description: An online tip was submitted to the FBI's National Threat Operations Center (NTOC) via tips.fbi.gov, reporting the sighting of Maxwell and other information.

locations: Forest behind a home (location implied to be in New Hampshire based on context of Maxwell's fugitive status)
Toronto (mentioned as location where a philanthropist was murdered)
keyFacts: In April 2020, while Ghislaine Maxwell was a fugitive, a public tip was submitted to the FBI claiming a sighting of her with two children in a forested residential area.
The tip describes a red Mini Cooper with white trim parked at a location from April 10-14, 2020, allegedly associated with Maxwell.
The tip speculatively links the sighting to the murder of a philanthropist in Toronto, suggesting a possible connection to the 'Epstien Maxwell organisation'.
The tip was processed by an FBI Threat Intake Examiner (TIE) at the National Threat Operations Center and forwarded to the New York VCAC/Human Trafficking unit for situational awareness.
The witness chose to remain anonymous, not providing a phone number but indicating the FBI should have it on file from past reports.
